result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M. Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he believes such contraband as defined in Chapter 961 may be present.
Defendant shall not associate with individuals who use illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed - to be used at Agent's discretion.
Defendant may serve in Portage County or Waupaca County.
